statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Ronnie Boyce shot 12 for 18 from the field and scored 25 points and Devin Watson added 21 as San Francisco beat Pepperdine 82-72 Thursday night.
article.headline: San Francisco pulls away from Pepperdine in 82-72 win
article.linkText: San Francisco pulls away from Pepperdine in 82-72 win
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. -- Ronnie Boyce shot 12 for 18 from the field and scored 25 points and Devin Watson added 21 as San Francisco beat Pepperdine 82-72 Thursday night. Senior forward Stacy Davis led Pepperdine with 20 points to become the leading scorer in school history. The previous record-holder, Dane Suttle, had 1,701 points between 1979-80 and 1980-83. Davis entered the game against San Francisco with 1,693 points. His ninth point, to pass Suttle, came on a basket with 7:22 left in the first half. Davis also grabbed 12 rebounds. San Francisco (15-11, 8-7 West Coast Conference) outscored Pepperdine (16-11, 9-7) by a 19-10 margin in the game's final 6:48 to seal the win. Watson hit a 3 and Uche Ofoegbu made two free throws to make it 80-69 with just more than a minute to play.
